result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Basil Saville Jones

records.addlTxt: Same appearances.  Guilty plea entered. Court finds def guilty and enters judgment.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Basil Saville Jones in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  (Sheboygan Co. 22CT296; 22CT268; 22TR3494; 22TR3495; Ozaukee Co. 22CT341; Fond du Lac Co. 22CT338)  Def waives right to attorney.  Recess.  State holds pretrial.  Case recalled at 5:14 p.m.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 9:25 a.m.  (Sheboygan Co. 22CT268; 22TR3494; 22TR3495; Ozaukee Co. 22CT341; Fond du Lac Co. 22CT338)  Defendant called Clerk of Court this morning and indicated he did not have a ride and was advised a warrant may be issued.  State does not oppose an adjournment.  Court stays warrant.
Hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Basil Saville Jones in court.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. (Fond du Lac Co. 22CT338; Sheboygan Co. 22CT268)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant referred to State Public Defender.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Court orders $250.00 signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Basil Saville Jones not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at 12:08 p.m.   Defendant called court and advised just obtained employment and is on probation and court agreed to reschedule.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 08:15 am.
